crip package¶

Submodules¶

crip.io module¶

I/O module of crip.

by z0gSh1u @ https://github.com/z0gSh1u/crip

crip.io.imreadDicom(path)¶

Read DICOM file. Return numpy array.

crip.io.imreadRaw(path, h, w, dtype=<class 'numpy.float32'>, nSlice=1, offset=0)¶

Read binary raw file. Return numpy array. offset in bytes.

crip.io.imreadTiff(path)¶

Read TIFF file. Return numpy array.

crip.io.imwriteRaw(img, path, dtype='keep')¶

Write raw file.

crip.io.imwriteTiff(img, path, dtype='keep')¶

Write TIFF file.

crip.io.listDirectory(folder, sort='nat', joinFolder=False)¶

List files under folder and sort using “nat” (natural) or “dict” (dictionary) order. Set joinFolder to True to get the paths, otherwise filename only.

crip.mangoct module¶

crip.physics module¶

Physics module of crip.

by z0gSh1u @ https://github.com/z0gSh1u/crip

crip.physics.calcMuWater(spectrum, unit='keV', rhoWater=1.0)¶

Calculate mu value (mm^-1) of water according to a specified spectrum (@see readSpectrum for specturm format) considering only energies in diagonstic range (10 ~ 150 keV).

crip.physics.readAtten(content, rho)¶

Read NIST ASCII format attenuation coefficient list. rho in (g/cm^3). Returns energy (MeV) and corresponding mu value (mm^-1).

crip.physics.readSpectrum(content, unit='keV')¶

Read spectrum list whose unit of energy is keV. Return energies in keV and omega. Set unit to eV if the unit in spectrum is eV.

crip.postprocess module¶

Postprocess module of crip.

by z0gSh1u @ https://github.com/z0gSh1u/crip

crip.preprocess module¶

Preprocess module of crip.

by z0gSh1u @ https://github.com/z0gSh1u/crip

crip.preprocess.averageProjections(projections)¶

Average projections. For example, to calculate the flat field.

crip.preprocess.flatDarkFieldCorrection(projection, flat, coeff=1, dark=None)¶

Perform flat field (air) and dark field correction to get post-log value.

crip.preprocess.flatDarkFieldCorrectionStandalone(projection)¶

Perform flat field and dark field correction without actual field image. Air is estimated using the brightest pixel.

crip.preprocess.gaussianNoiseInject(projection, sigma)¶

Inject Gaussian noise which obeys distribution N(0, sigma^2).

crip.preprocess.limitedAngle(projections, srcDeg, dstDeg, startDeg=0)¶

Sample limited angle projections from startDeg to startDeg + dstDeg. The original total angle is srcDeg.

crip.preprocess.limitedView(projections, ratio)¶

Sample projections uniformly with ::ratio to get sparse views projections. The second returning is the number of remaining projections.

crip.preprocess.padProjection(proj, padding, mode='symmetric', smootherDecay=False)¶

Extend the projection on four directions using symmetric padding (Up, Right, Down, Left) and descending cosine window decay. mode can be symmetric or edge.

crip.preprocess.projectionsToSinograms(projections)¶

Permute projections to sinograms by axes swapping (views, h, w) -> (h, views, w).

crip.preprocess.sinogramsToProjections(sinograms)¶

Permute sinograms back to projections by axes swapping (h, views, w) -> (views, h, w).

crip.shared module¶

Shared module of crip.

by z0gSh1u @ https://github.com/z0gSh1u/crip

crip.shared.binning(projection, binning=(1, 1))¶

Perform binning on row and col directions. binning=(rowBinning, colBinning).

crip.shared.gaussianSmooth(projection, sigma, ksize=None)¶

Perform Gaussian smooth with kernel size = ksize and Gaussian sigma = sigma (int or tuple (x, y)). Leave ksize = None to auto determine to include the majority of Gaussian energy.

crip.shared.resize(projection, dsize=None, fH=None, fW=None, interp='bicubic')¶

Resize the projection to dsize (H, W) (if dsize is not None) or scale by ratio (fH, fW) using interp (bicubic, linear, nearest available).

crip.shared.rotate(img, deg)¶

Rotate img by deg [DEG] (multiple of 90) clockwise.

crip.utils module¶

Utilities of crip.

by z0gSh1u @ https://github.com/z0gSh1u/crip
